Why there is twice precision in range type?
```julia> 2.0:2.4 |> typeof
StepRangeLen{Float64, Base.TwicePrecision{Float64}, Base.TwicePrecision{Float64}}```

elements.text: Why there is twice precision in range type?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

It’s an internal detail used to make ranges exact, to Float64's precision, rather than accumulating rounding errors:
```julia> 0.1:0.3:1 |> last
1.0

julia> 0.1 + 0.3 * 3
0.9999999999999999```
